CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 30, 1962, pg. 4, reads: "Homeless Fire Victims - Mrs. Bannie Copland (front center) sits surrounded by several of her children and grandchildren, who were left homeless when a three-alarm fire destroyed their home in Wickhaven, Pa., early Sunday morning. They were not able to save any of their possessions.  Seventeen of the 20 victims are being sheltered in a converted schoolhouse occupied by Mrs. Copland's daughter, Mrs. Jean Burton. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of fire victims, many from Copland family, including Bannie Copland seated in center, posed in front of brick building, with shirtless boy in background on left, in Wickhaven, Pennsylvania
